value.title: DAX Fridays #204: Slice by the results of a measure
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to turn your measure into a slicer? Here is how you do  it!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1  Our PLAYLISTS:

value.title: DAX Fridays! #213 : Year-to-date Same period previous years IN ONE MEASURE!
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to calculate year to date for the same period previous years, all in one measure!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered.  Link to Power BI file: http://gofile.me/2kEOD/jSGFzsbB3  PREVIOUS VIDEO: USERELATIONSHIP

value.title: DAX Fridays! #32: FORMAT
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through FORMAT function in DAX. We will learn how to use pre-formated functions and custom functions to format numbers and dates using DAX.  Link to download the file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/FORMAT-dax   EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. It is very useful for solving issues with many to many relationships and performance issues.  Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #82: How to learn DAX for beginners
value.excerpt: So you want to know which path to take to learn DAX and you want to use my DAX Fridays! videos? No problem, in this video, I have put together a list of the order you could follow to learn DAX based on the function difficulties, the common needs on the report and your previous experience. value.title: DAX Fridays! #85: Difference between dates in the same column
value.excerpt: Do you know how to calculate the difference between dates when both are in the same column?  One example of when this is needed is when you are working with subscription based services. If you want to calculate how many dates go between users changing subscriptions, this DAX measure will help you.  To

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box.  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/median-dax-functions

value.title: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression
value.excerpt: What is Vertipaq and how does it work? Part 1: Data compression Vertipaq is the database and engine that runs on top of Power BI and PowerPivot.   When we import data in Power BI, the Vertipaq database will try with a series of algorithms, to compress the data as much as possible and the best way possible

value.title: DAX Beginners - SUM Vs SUMX in Power BI - What, When and Where?
value.excerpt: Welcome to Wed with Dax beginner series. During this episode, we will talk about two interesting DAX expressions. SUM and SUMX. We will compare both DAX expressions in detail. First, I will explain When to use SUM and when to use SUMX. We will talk about the difference between SUM and SUMX functions
